channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 4 or 5 Xmas trees dumped on pavement and road by bike lockups plus another outside no 57 Reighton Road, 23rd January
item.description:
Discarded Xmas trees on road and pavement and one outside no 57 Reighton Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooke Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping of garden waste in wheelie bin, disposal of Xmas tree, 23rd January
item.description:
When I checked my bin this morning just before midday, someone had dumped two black / grey bags apparently containing garden waste, ie tree or shrub clippings. I removed these from my bin, and placed them beside it, inside the property. On another matter, is it possible for LBB to remove the Christmas tree placed there by a resident?

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken drain cover and road surface, 23rd January
item.description:
Previously reported a sinking drain cover (ref: 7066742). Thames Water came out last year but replaced the two drain covers adjacent instead. The drain cover has continued to sink and the tarmac is starting to break up around it. The undulating road surface as a result of the sinking drain is an ongoing issue when larger vehicles (particularly buses and trucks) pass over it, whereby they bounce up and back down on to the road surface. This creates a loud noise which disturbs residents nearby. Please can the drain cover and surrounding surface therefore be addressed in order to resolve the ongoing noise issue?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Romanhurst Gardens, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing water / burst pipe, 23rd January
item.description:
Water overflowing from Thames WATER manhole in pavement outside Grunfield Court, Bethune Rd

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bethune Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: EBike Menace - Carelessly Abandoned junction Dowells Street & Norway Street, 23rd January
item.description:
Carelessly abandoned Forest eBikes are blocking adjacent narrow pavements... these eBikes have been abandoned on adjacent Footpaths deliberately blocking the two Footpaths... this behaviour is grossly unacceptable and dangerously anti-social... Forest eBikes are an unacceptable menace on our Footpaths - this is not only selfish, it is also dangerous... Users must face the consequences of their selfish actions... I invite you to, please, to issue a final warning, or a £100 fine...

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Norway Street, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Escaped or abandoned dog, 23rd January
item.description:
This dog came from Old Farm Allotment coming out of the west gate. It is loose and been running in the road causing a nuisance and affecting traffic. Again this morning while out unloading the car the dog was seen in middle of the road trying to go to the toilet. 2 members of public tried to catch it but it ran back into the allotment. Last Sat the mini stopped as it was causing an obstruction. We seen the dog a lot living in the allotment as it comes and goes from the west gate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 276, Old Farm Avenue, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping on calypso crescent, 23rd January

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Calypso Crescent, Old Kent Road, Greater London

item.title: Hole and surround created in Autumn 2024, 23rd January
item.description:
We have been waiting for a tree to be planted since Autumn 2024, the hole and surround has been created outside 2 Cranmore Road, BR7 6ES and the same has been created outside 1 Cranmore Road. We received an email from you saying that the tree would be planted in Autumn 2025/Spring 2026. The other trees were planted in neighbouring properties in Autumn 2024 and want to confirm that ours will be planted this year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cranmore Road, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Workmen not wearing PPE, 23rd January
item.description:
I observed workmen repairing the potholes in the road this morning. They were operating heavy and noisy machinery and only one was wearing PPE (ear defenders and respiratory protection). As an occupational health professional I know that they should be wearing PPE to reduce the risks of noise and dust. Their manager should be informed that they are not compliant with PPE rules.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Padua Road, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: DANGEROUS Public Health Hazard - Medical Waste Fly-Tipping - Greenwich Quay, 23rd January
item.description:
Medical Waste is being fly-tipped in and around the Greenwich Quay bin store... This area is frequently used by fly-tippers and has been for several years... residents deserve a permanent solution please... Continuation of FYS ref: 8639561

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Creek Road, Deptford
Report on FixMyStreet
